TextBody:
When copying the certificate, did you also include the lines with ----- BEGIN----- and -------END------?
If not, please also include those as in the backend the process does not know to add them.
Since it is a .pem file, it might contain the entire chain, so add all certificates from there not just the first one.
Please let me know if you are still not able to see the certificate change after 5 - 10 minutes after you add them again.

Thank you,
Eduard Nut
Technical Support Engineer

Endpoint Protector now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection
eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
CoSoSys Ltd
www.endpointprotector.com

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000CmcAb:ref

Eduard,

"When copying the certificate, did you also include the lines with ----- BEGIN----- and -------END------?
If not, please also include those as in the backend the process does not know to add them."

These were included the first and subsequent attempts to update the certificate.

"Please let me know if you are still not able to see the certificate change after 5 - 10 minutes after you add them again."

I even restarted the vAppliance but to no avail. Still has the old certificate. Are there CLI instructions for updating the certificate on the vAppliance? I am willing to try that if necessary.

Thank you,
________________________________

When copying the certificate, did you also include the lines with ----- BEGIN----- and -------END------?
If not, please also include those as in the backend the process does not know to add them.
Since it is a .pem file, it might contain the entire chain, so add all certificates from there not just the first one.
Please let me know if you are still not able to see the certificate change after 5 - 10 minutes after you add them again.

Thank you,
Eduard Nut

TextBody:
Hi Stephen,

Access to the backend is not provided out of the box, that comes after a whole legal process. But I can upload and enable the certificate and key on the server. For that, I will need a .crt and .key files to overwrite the ones already there.
For copying, we will need an FTP client like Filezilla or CoreFTP.
Please make sure we have SSH access to the server and a snapshot of the appliance before we have our meeting.
Send me your timezone and availability for tomorrow and Friday and I will set it up.

Thank you,
Eduard Nut
Technical Support Engineer

Endpoint Protector now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection
eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
CoSoSys Ltd
www.endpointprotector.com
